title: George Hughes (rugby)
text:
George Edgar Hughes (24 February 1870 – 6 October 1947) was an English <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> footballer who played in the 1890s. He played at representative level for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a>, and at club level for <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow</a>, as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a>, e.g. <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Front%20row">front row</a>, <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Locks">lock</a>, or <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Back%20row">back row</a>. Prior to April 1897, Barrow was a <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> club.
Background.
George Hughes was born in <a href="Otley">Otley</a>, <a href="West%20Riding%20of%20Yorkshire">West Riding of Yorkshire</a>, and he died aged 77 in <a href="Walney%20Island">Walney-in-Barrow</a>, <a href="Lancashire">Lancashire</a>.
Playing career.
International honours.
George Hughes won a cap for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a> while at Barrow in 1896 against Scotland.
Change of Code.
When Barrow converted from the <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> code to the <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> code in April 1897, George Hughes would have been 27 years of age. Consequently, he may have been both a rugby union and rugby league footballer for Barrow.
